Recall bias: Recall bias occurs when participants have difficulty accurately recalling past events or experiences. There is no evidence of recall bias in this study.

Selection bias: Selection bias occurs when participants are not randomly selected or assigned to groups, leading to a non-representative sample. There is no evidence of selection bias in this study.
